meanings.definition: To complete or enhance something by adding something else that makes it whole or perfect.
meanings.sent1: The delicious sauce complemented the pasta perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The red shoes complemented her outfit beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The funny hat complemented his serious expression, creating a quirky look.
meanings.sent4: Her cheerful personality complemented the gloomy weather, brightening everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The soft music complemented the romantic atmosphere of the restaurant, setting the mood for the evening.

meanings.definition: To go well with something else to make a whole.
meanings.sent1: The warm bread complemented the hearty soup nicely.
meanings.sent2: The blue tie complemented his white shirt perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The colorful flowers complemented the plain room, adding a pop of color.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter complemented the joyful atmosphere of the party, spreading happiness around.
meanings.sent5: The fresh herbs complemented the dish, enhancing its flavors.
